Today Crandall Middle School 8th grade students had the opportunity to see government in action.

House District 4 Representative Keith Bell, spoke to Coach Luecke's class about what it's like to have a career in government. He talked about his path to legislature, his passion for public education, and broke down some of the technicalities in election cycles, and how the census affects his constituents.

"Chills ran up my spine when I thought about the privilege, the opportunity and the responsibility that I had, to have a desk on that house floor," said Representative Bell, when talking about our State Capital.

Representative Bell served on the Pub Ed Committee and Criminal Jurisprudence Committee for the 85th Texas Legislature.

Crandall ISD Parents,

Last night, a terroristic threat was posted on social media relating to Crandall High School. Once again, we will not tolerate threats made to our staff and students., We take all threats, including social media threats to be serious in nature. An investigation was conducted and the student was arrested. Not only will this student be held to the Crandall ISD student code of conduct, they will also receive consequences related to charges for making a terroristic threat.

This is an excellent opportunity to talk with your students about the seriousness of these actions. While some students may post things, or share things, intending to be funny, we take any and all threats to the safety of our students and staff seriously. Our students' safety is our utmost priority, and together we will continue to make Crandall ISD the safest learning environment possible.

Homecoming 2019

Homecoming football games got their start in our rich history of football culture back in the early days of football. Originally intended as an alumni weekend, the festivities later evolved into the crowning of a King and Queen and incorporated the festive mums we all know and love.

Tonight, Crandall ISD became a part of homecoming tradition and legend.

At our pre-game ceremonies tonight, two incredible Pirates were awarded the coveted title of King and Queen. Travis Stevens and Shaylee Wickersham have both been a part of Crandall ISD since they were in Kindergarten.

Shaylee and Travis demonstrate our three values of Character, Compassion, and Community every day. They are a friend to others. They show kindness and acceptance. They are eager to lend a helping hand, show love and there is no shortage of love surrounding them.

It is no wonder that Crandall High School was proud to crown these two extraordinary students.

#PiratesForever
#HappyHomecoming2019

Martin Elementary held a sorting ceremony today!

In an effort to build a sense of community across the campus, Martin Elementary followed the model set by the Ron Clark Academy of aligning students to different groups, or "houses."

Students will sit with their houses, rather than their homerooms during lunch, in assemblies and will earn points for their houses based on positive choices made by house members.

"We wanted to find a way to build relationships, establish teammates and develop accountability," said Instructional Coach, Alek Turner.

Each staff member, with the exception of the Principal and Assistant Principal, will also belong to a house.

"Kinder and 1st grade will stay with their classes, but every other grade level will be mixed up in order to build school-wide community," said Catrina Jones, Testing Coordinator.

The four houses that Martin selected are Integritas, (Integrity), Persistemo, (Perseverance), Valor (Courage), and Compaixon (Compassion)

shared_text:
Crandall Police Department
February 21, 2019 at 9:20 PM ·

Press Release

On 02/21/2019 at approximately 12:00 pm the Crandall Police Department was dispatched to Barbara Walker Elementary School in reference to a 911 call referencing a possible Bomb Threat at the campus.

Using information obtained from the recorded 911 call that discredited a threat to the campus, the direction for Building Confinement of the campus was given to Crandall ISD staff instead of evacuation.

For precautionary reasons, with the Assistance of the Kaufman County Sheriff’s Office, Crandall Police Officers searched each room of the campus and gave the all clear at approximately 1:30 pm. The Crandall Police Department transitioned into the investigatory process to track the caller.

We want to thank the ISD staff and parents for their assistance and patience during the Crandall Police Department response.

Dean Winters
Chief of Police
Crandall Police Department
112 S. Main Street, Crandall, Texas 75114

It's that time of the year for our Black/White scrimmage and food drive event. The scrimmage will take place Friday, November 2nd at Crandall HS from 4:00 - 5:30. This is the boys first opportunity of the year to demonstrate all the hard work. It’s also an opportunity for them learn to give back to the community by raising some canned goods for the local food bank. Everyone is invited to come support the cause.

If you are getting this message late, no worries. We are happy to accept food donations at our Saturday morning practice or even next week if anyone in the community wants to participate.
